content.description: Beginner Route is a very simple route. It is a great route for people's first time climbing. There are multiple ledges and cracks with lots of hand holds and foot holds. Highly recommend for your first time. The bolts are located on the highest rock at the top of the climb. This route is also a great route for people new to rappelling because it's an easy ledge to go over and isn't too high.
content.location: Continue walking to the left at the bottom of the wall. Continue along the wall till you come across this route. It is a little ways from the rest of the climbs.

content.description: The Tenderfoot Wall is a small area that is great for beginners. It only has two faces that are full of cracks and good holds. This area is good for new climbers, but is also good for those new to rappelling. There is a large ledge to back off of and it is a short wall, making is easier to learn how to rappel. The bolts are on top of the large boulder at the top of the rock, so there is a short climb to set the anchor. This is safe as long as you are careful.Â
